column1: Why did the writer have a problem with the mouse pads ? [SEP] I ' ve never traditionally been picky about my mouse pad . " [SEP]  (A) They picked the pads up at promotion booths (B) They were too small for FPS gaming (C) Their feelings have been changed since trying the Evo - G MP1 pad (D) They 've never been picky about mouse pads

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer does n't look disabled on the outside ? column1: What might happen because of the legislation ? [SEP] That 's right - this empowerment of young women was motivated by legislation introduced to increase access for young women to quality athletic training and competition . This is indeed the life breath of the civil rights movement in action motivating today 's teens to invest their hearts and souls in the realization of their potential . Sometimes I think we take the effects of Title IX for granted , but whether watching the finest female athletes in the country competing on a world stage , or watching teenage girls working together to win a high school volleyball match , the benefits become clear . These girls are the women who will lead us to a brighter tomorrow . [SEP]  (A) Less females would have the opportunity to become athletes . (B) The effects of Title IX would be reduced . (C) More females would have the opportunity to become athletes . (D) Young women would have to take the world stage to fight against the legislation .
column2: More females would have the opportunity to become athletes .

column1: What would be the value in recruiting that many women ? [SEP] One in seven couples in the UK experience infertility . Unexplained infertility affects a quarter of these couples and common interventions to help them have been used for many years in line with fertility guidelines issued by the National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence ( NICE ) . A team of researchers led by the University of Aberdeen compared the effectiveness of two specific interventions with expectant management ( no treatment ) . They recruited 580 women who had experienced unexplained infertility for more than two years from four teaching hospitals and a district general hospital in Scotland . [SEP]  (A) The studies are more likely to render good and diverse results (B) None of the above choices . (C) The women will be competitive making the study more interesting (D) The study will be able to take a longer time suggesting that there will be more funding
column2: The studies are more likely to render good and diverse results

column1: Why does the writer not expect to need a steak knife to eat fish ? [SEP] If you 're not expecting it , and it really does n't go with the dish , it 's bloody awful . I do n't know if sand whiting is always like that , or they just did n't clean it properly , but I do n't expect to need a steak knife to eat fish . There was no seasoning on the fish , and too much in the saffron broth ( which was more like a reduction ) that was poured over it . I assume they thought it would balance the dish out , but it did n't . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Because the knife really does n't go with the dish . (C) Because fish is supposed to be soft . (D) Because the fish had Mediterranean stuffing .
column2: Because fish is supposed to be soft .

column1: Why do people shop on Black Friday ? [SEP] Hi friends , I was just browsing through the internet when I stumbled upon a site which is related to the black friday circular . It was very interesting to go through this site and to say the least I was just fascinated by it . The black friday falls on November 28th of this year and most people in this world are looking forward to that momentous day . The black friday comes a day after the Thanksgiving day and hence people can save money when they shop on that day for Christmas . [SEP]  (A) Because it falls on November 28th (B) Because the writer was browsing the internet (C) Because people around the world are looking forward to it (D) None of the above choices .
column2: None of the above choices .

[SEP]  (A) I am just not good at math so it was better I did n't take it . (B) I 'm so good at English that I wo n't need math at all . (C) It would have added to my already heavy workload . (D) I would have to practice at it and I"m no good at practicing .

(B) I love watching storms but I have n't seen any since I moved . (C) I was happy to play outside in the rain and cool air . (D) I was glad that we would finally get rain for the plants .
column2: I love watching storms but I have n't seen any since I moved .

column1: What am I talking about ? [SEP] What is the ideal of the rule of law ? An initial observation is that there are several different conceptions of the meaning of the rule of law . Dicey 's Influential Formulation Historically , the most influential account of the rule of law was offered by A.V. [SEP]  (A) How to influence the law makers . column1: What may have caused you to share the laptop with your mom ? My mom ( although she is not as paranoid about Internet security as I am ) decided that she wanted a laptop dedicated to her Internet use ( browsing and some online games ) . Unfortunately , she did n't want to spend much on it , and she did n't want a netbook ; so at first she could n't find anything in her price range that I would allow into the apartment . We solved the problem by agreeing to share the Internet laptop and buying it together . [SEP]  (A) She desired one but did n't want to deal with the price . (B) None of the above choices . column2: She desired one but did n't want to deal with the price .

column1: Why might President Bush veto the bill ? [SEP] All but 15 Republicans voted against the act . This fact helped lead to this week 's second development which I will discuss a bit later . First things first . [SEP]  (A) Because 15 Republicans votes against it . (B) Because the bill was dead in the water . (C) Because he opposes it . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Because he opposes it .

column1: Why is Fanny refreshed instead of fatigued ? [SEP] All the colors , chocolate brown earth and yellow - green budding trees , and the red shirt of a farmer in the distance , had a crisp brightness to them . " Are you tired , Fanny ? " he asked after a few minutes . " No , not at all - I ought to be , but somehow in such beauty I am refreshed instead of fatigued . " " Then let us go back slowly , and we can talk as we go . " She turned , keeping to a walk , and he came up with her on the outside . [SEP]  (A) Because a man was keeping her company . (B) She is in a pleasant environment . (C) Because a man asked if she was tired . (D) Because the farmer was wearing a red shirt
column2: She is in a pleasant environment .

column1: What do they know about depression ? [SEP] When you have a stigmatized illness such as depression or bipolar disorder there is much comfort in meeting others - even on the page of a book - who have endured the same desperation and have come out the other side . For me , learning about the physiology of depression and the chemistry of the brain gave me tremendous relief . These writings convinced me I was not weak or lazy . I was sick . [SEP]  (A) That being depressed is normal . (B) That it is caused by the brain . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Thqat depression is not caused by the brain .
column2: That it is caused by the brain .

column2: That they are not weak of lazy , but ill .

column1: Why were former employees were coming out with their stuff in boxes ? [SEP] Yesterday on Marketplace , they were broadcasting from outside Lehmann Bros. in New York City . They mentioned that as former employees were coming out with their stuff in boxes , not only was the press chasing them down the street with cameras trying to get a comment , but tourists were actually snapping photos . I know how horrible I felt the two times I was laid off from a company I really loved , believed in , and had put my whole heart into . (B) Beacuse it was on Marketplace . (C) Because it was in New York City . (D) Because they were broadcasting from outside Lehmann Bros.
column2: Because they just got laid off .

column1: Why was the nation 's divided self reuniting ? [SEP] The backdrop is of post - war Germany and all of its peoples ' homecoming tales , and later , the nation 's divided self reuniting . The book touches on evil , justice , ethics and morals and the place of each in both the psyche and the modern world . I related to the protagonist quite strongly ; his ultimate decision reflects my own approach to dealing with my father 's behaviour , and for many of the same reasons . My only criticism is that the female characters , with the exception of the protagonist 's mother , while believable and real , seemed a little two - dimensional , a little too straightforward in their complex world . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) That is the way forward . (C) The book touches on evil . (D) The book touches on justice .
column2: That is the way forward .

column1: Why were we so busy during Christmas ? Now , as you can expect for this sort of thing , we were very busy in the run up to Christmas . So , there were a few happenings that might have ended up on Bad Service , but for the most part we got the products out on time with no corners cut . [SEP]  (A) People send a lot of post during Christmas (B) People wanted pictures for their Christmas cards (C) People wanted to go shopping a lot at Christmas (D) People often get part time jobs around Christmas

[SEP]  (A) The temperature was in the pleasant 90s . (B) It cooled down to 20 degrees . (C) It cooled down . (D) None of the above choices .

column1: What caused you to experience a warm flash ? [SEP] So , I took a break from unpacking boxes and sorting clothes because I was having a warm flash . I got a glass of cold water and sat down to check e - mail and LJ for a bit . Before I took a break , all the cats were sprawled all over , taking their post - lunch nap ( not to be confused , of course , with the pre - lunch nap or even the pre - dinner nap ) . Just now , I went back into my bedroom , where piles of clothes are currently covering my bed and guess where all my cats are ? [SEP]  (A) My constant fussing over the cats causes me to get hot from constantly worrying about them (B) Having to go up and down the stairs to find the cats causes my heartrate to accelerate and that gives me a warm flash (C) I am prone to warm flashes because I am in bad health and my heartrate accelerates constantly throughout the day (D) I was working on unpacking boxes , sorting clothing and generally cleaning up and it is hot out so my internal temperature went up from the work
column2: I was working on unpacking boxes , sorting clothing and generally cleaning up and it is hot out so my internal temperature went up from the work

column1: How do I feel about religion after my mother died ? [SEP] In retrospect , it was n't sudden - it was a reaction that I had been suppressing for some time against the way men ran my faith , and men sat in power over me in the confessional and over intimate moments of my life when I felt I had to ask permission to seek fertility treatments and read harsh literature by the pope about being ' selfish ' for choosing such help . And it all came to a head at Mom 's deathbed , when I looked into her eyes and was n't sure what I saw , recognition or nothing . I know there were no angels that I could see , or departed family members she spoke to , and it made me doubt . It shook my foundations and made me doubt . And then the shoe dropped . [SEP]  (A) God was still a large part of my life . (B) None of the above choices . (C) I stopped believing in God . (D) I continued believing in God .
column2: I stopped believing in God .

column1: Why did he take off in a flurry of great disgust ? [SEP] He took off in a flurry of great disgust . Kim and I shook our heads and decided to go ahead . [SEP]  (A) Because we rode down the narrow trail . (B) Because Kim and I decided to go ahead . (C) Because he was very upset about something . (D) Because Kim and I shook our heads .
column2: Because he was very upset about something .

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer 's nephew loves to draw ? column1: What is probably true about the narrator ? [SEP] Now , for your viewing pleasure , and in a shameless instance of self promotion and of tooting my own horn , I present to you Bootlegged : The Untold Story of the 21st Amendment . If the video does n't work , click here . Now , this of course should not be taken seriously , or seen as anything more than an attempt at historical fiction . But I do find it interesting to think back on the eras of the past , and think about those Mormons who viewed their faith , and even defined their orthodoxy , in ways very different than we do now . [SEP]  (A) They are proud of the video they made (B) They are not proud of the video they made (C) They do not enjoy learning about history (D) They think Mormon history is boring
column2: They are proud of the video they made

column1: What would happen if the mujahedin entered into war with the Kabul ? [SEP] The regime collapsed while it still possessed material superiority . column2: The mujahedin would win the war because of their superior stores and reserves

column1: Why might someone spend their time helping out new players ? [SEP] One argument that I ' ve heard relating to this is that such a change would literally kill the old world content , and be detrimental to new people to the game as they try to level up . Honestly , though , is n't that already the case ? When someone who has one or more 70s levels an alt , do they spend their time helping out new players , and teaching them how to survive in Azeroth ? Or do they blow through the lower levels as quickly as they possibly can , either alone , multi - boxed , or with guildmates ? [SEP]  (A) Because that 's a nice thing to do . (B) Because that would literally kill the old world content . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because that would be detrimental to new people to the game .
column2: Because that 's a nice thing to do .

column1: What may have caused your acid reflux ? [SEP] August 20 , 2008 I was definitely surprised yesterday when the doctor told me that the baby has already dropped into my pelvis and into a nice position for delivery , but now that I compare the photo from this week and last week , it 's pretty obvious ! I had previously read that the drop is usually accompanied by relief from acid reflux and shortness of breath , both of which are still very present for me . But I ' m not a very big person , and there 's not much room for this still - growing kid , so it looks like I 'll just have to tough it out for a few more weeks . [SEP]  (A) I just finished being pregnant and delivering a baby . (B) I was told by my doctor that my stomach was in the wrong position . (C) I was pregnant . (D) I got acid reflux from eating spicy food .
column2: I was pregnant .

column1: What may be true about Sound Bite Communications ? column1: Why was it important to delay departure to Saturday afternoon ? [SEP] On Saturday , January 22 , 2005 , Dustin and I drove back up to the Boundary Waters to retrieve the rest of our camping gear , our snowshoes , and try to find my pack on the northern shore of Duncan Lake . We had planned on leaving Friday night , but the entire state of Minnesota was blanketed with at least a foot of snow . So we left Saturday afternoon instead . [SEP]  (A) Duncan Lake was closed to traffic due to heavy snow . (B) Heavy snow caused a delay in retrieving camping equipment . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Finding the lost camping gear in the snow was difficult .
column2: Heavy snow caused a delay in retrieving camping equipment .

column1: What may have caused you to switch to a balanced stance ? On the up side , I learned that putting all that weight on my shield foot was limiting my offensive options , so I ' m going to a more balanced stance . (B) I had trouble going on offense . (C) None of the above choices . (D) I had trouble going on defense .

column1: What does your brother behave this way towards you ? Peter 's always known one thing for sure in his life , one utter certainty and that is the simple fact that Nathan loves him , completely and totally and despite everything , it 's the one thing that he 's never once doubted . The hours before the explosion ( his mother and his brother and the doubt that had crept in ) had shaken that belief but his brother had pulled through , had been the man who had checked him for injuries years before . [SEP]  (A) he does not like seeing his family and gets annoyed when he has to (B) He has grown up angry and cold and even though he loves me he struggles to show it at times (C) he hates having to spend time with friends and family and so he ignores me as long as he can (D) None of the above choices .

column1: Why was an alarm supposed to go off ? [SEP] Right before my alarm was supposed to go off , I heard a strange mewing sound . (B) Because the writer needed to wake up at a certain time . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because the writer was expecting to hear some mewing .

column1: Why was I working at the drive - thru at my pharmacy ? [SEP] Work : So the most amazing thing happened earlier . I was working at the drive - thru at my pharmacy ( think McDonalds with xanax happy meals ) and I walk up to the window and see this woman like .... outside of her car with the back door open .... about to administer textbook corporeal punishment to her children . Once she realized I was there she put on the most convincing guise of composure and chit chatted a bit before cutting to the chase . The chase was this : After her marriage of four years , her husband apparently flipped out . [SEP]  (A) Because I saw a woman outside her car . (B) Because the most amazing thing happened earlier . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because I walked up to the window .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: How did we get fruit salad ? [SEP] Cor had logged off by that time , and my stomach growled loudly . Reminding me that my last full meal had been two days before at lunch , snacks and water did not count . So I told Jen I would be back and headed upstairs for breakfast . Ordered fruit salad ( lots of mangos ) , a mango lassi ( hopefully mangos ) and nutella on toast ( I ' m almost certain there were no mangos ) . A little too much sweet for me , but filling and made me happy . [SEP]  (A) Somebody else made it for us . (B) It was a gift from the hotel owner . (C) We collected mangos around the place . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Somebody else made it for us .

column1: How did we get fruit salad ? [SEP] Cor had logged off by that time , and my stomach growled loudly . Reminding me that my last full meal had been two days before at lunch , snacks and water did not count . So I told Jen I would be back and headed upstairs for breakfast . Ordered fruit salad ( lots of mangos ) , a mango lassi ( hopefully mangos ) and nutella on toast ( I ' m almost certain there were no mangos ) . A little too much sweet for me , but filling and made me happy . [SEP]  (A) We collected mangos around the place . (B) It was a gift from the hotel owner . (C) We had paid for it . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: We had paid for it .

column1: How might I feel about meetings at work ? [SEP] Something to cheer about : I finally finished my first X - Files vid ! Woohoo ! ! ! Something to jeer about : Back to work tomorrow . ( It would n't be so bad if I could just go to my office ; instead , I 'll be subjected to at least half a day of meetings and administrative pep talks first . [SEP]  (A) I might feel that the meetings at work are useless waste of time . (B) I might feel that the meetings at work are a good use of time . (C) I might feel that the meetings at work are useful but a waste of time . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: I might feel that the meetings at work are useless waste of time .

column1: What might be different if there were not too many trees ? [SEP] There are trees and bushes and plants and grass growing all over , throughout campus , downtown , everywhere . I can hardly see the building across the street through my dorm window because there are too many trees . People smile at you everywhere . [SEP]  (A) They could not see the building across the street (B) They would n't look through their dorm window (C) They could see the building across the street (D) People would n't smile at you everywhere
column2: They could see the building across the street

column1: What 's a possible reason people now really know the writer is fat ? [SEP] But also there 's my waist , and my bust , and my calves . The negative : now people really know that I ' m fat ( as if they did n't before . ) The positive : now they know what my fat really looks like , and that I do n't expect them to be scared of it or repulsed by it . This is n't meant to be a fat manifesto ; I do n't speak for all fat people 's experiences because I ca n't . [SEP]  (A) Because the writer posted a photo of themselves . (B) Because the writer does n't expect them to be scared of it . (C) Because there 's her waist . (D) Because this is n't a fat manifesto .
column2: Because the writer posted a photo of themselves .

column1: What may be causing you to draw all the clothing ? [SEP] I ' m all excited about new fall colors in clothing , as well as fleshing out our house a little more with some certain items ... Instead of going on a crazy bank breaking shopping spree , I decided to draw it all to get it out of my system temporarily ! If you would like to see the larger version , its here on my flickr . Very laid back lots of resting type of weekend . Chris was off working at the Faster Mustache 24-hour urban race and I was home alone for the majority of the weekend . [SEP]  (A) I want to make art out of it instead of buying it . (B) I wanted some drawings for my Flickr . (C) I needed to showcase the new fall colors in clothing . (D) I want to make art out of that people will buy .
column2: I want to make art out of it instead of buying it .

column1: What might have happened had you not taken a break between your errands ? [SEP] It seemed quieter , but that 's most likely because the Iron Chef celebrity tour bus was n't there . Actually , some of the usual market vendors were n't there , either . I do n't know if it was the crazy week , dehydration , or both , but I felt fairly miserable when I arrived , so I hung out for a bit and then took it easy on the ride home . After I got home , I sat around for a brief while and then set out again for a second round of errand - running and grocery - shopping . [SEP]  (A) I would have managed to get to bed sooner and feel better and more rested the next day (B) I would have been finished sooner and had more spare time to relax in the evening (C) I would have gotten sick and felt unable to do anything , thereby not completing any of my errands (D) I would have been able to finish all my errands and relaxed at home instead of relaxing while out
column2: I would have gotten sick and felt unable to do anything , thereby not completing any of my errands

column1: Why am I concentrating and focused ? [SEP] If I am concentrating and focused I can make out 80 % of what is being said to me . This makes the show of nodding and saying " Oui " or " bon " almost convincing . Of course , the instant I spy a shiny metal object , my attention is dragged away from the speaker and I am lost once again . Terrance , however , makes real and authentic attempts to speak in French . [SEP]  (A) Because I spied a shiny metal object . (B) Because I 'm interested . (C) Because I am lost once again . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Because I 'm interested .

column1: What happened before Ryan and Erin danced together for the first time as husband and wife ? [SEP] Roses were the flower of the day , hot pinks and light pinks with chocolate brown accents . Ryan joined Erin on the dance floor for their first dance together and as the sun began to dip down into the horizon . I love the look on their faces as they shared this intimate moment together dancing for the first time as husband and wife . [SEP]  (A) Ryan and Erin went to their friends ' wedding before they went to the reception . (B) None of the above choices . (C) Ryan and Erin 's wedding ceremony was held in a church before the reception . (D) Ryan and Erin went to the reception before they were married in a ceremony .
column2: Ryan and Erin 's wedding ceremony was held in a church before the reception .

column1: What happened before Ryan and Erin danced together for the first time as husband and wife ? [SEP] Roses were the flower of the day , hot pinks and light pinks with chocolate brown accents . Ryan joined Erin on the dance floor for their first dance together and as the sun began to dip down into the horizon . I love the look on their faces as they shared this intimate moment together dancing for the first time as husband and wife . [SEP]  (A) Ryan and Erin went to the reception before they were married in a ceremony . (B) Ryan and Erin went to their friends ' wedding before they went to the reception . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Ryan and Erin went to their friends ' reception after they went to the wedding .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer 's Mom has a torn rotator cuff ? [SEP] I was informed that Pickle naps every single day at rest time which blew me away because he quit napping at home a good 7 months ago . His teacher , magic . My mom is having surgery on the 30th for a torn rotator cuff . I have been popping over there now and again to see if she needs anything . [SEP]  (A) Because she injured herself doing a physical activity . (B) Because the writer has been popping over there now and again . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because Pickle naps every single day .
column2: Because she injured herself doing a physical activity .

column1: What will happen if you try the ring your periodontist suggested ? [SEP] First my ENT finally offered me the deviated septum surgery , which will be happening soon . Then the periodontist turning out to be extremely nice so that I actually got the gum graft I ' ve been putting off . And now this guy convincing me to try the ring , not to get my period more often ( dear god , I ca n't miss any more work from it -- who wants it 12 times a year ? ) [SEP]  (A) I will not get my period as regularly (B) I will get my period once a month (C) I will get my period at the same interval as before (D) I will not get any more periods ever again
column2: I will not get my period as regularly

column1: Why might I have not been able to ski or snowboard in 8 years ? [SEP] My only reservations lie with the financial situation , otherwise I would LOVE to go up there and just have fun with Jan. I ' m also excited to learn how to snowboard / ski all over again . Since it 's been about ... 8 fucking years . [SEP]  (A) I might have had financial issues but might have been able to find the time . (B) I might have had enough money and might have been able to find the time . (C) I might have had financial issues or might not have been able to find the time . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: I might have had financial issues or might not have been able to find the time .

column1: What may have been your father 's reason for asking you to keep the noise down ? [SEP] The living room and my father 's bedroom were not only adjacent , but were separated by only a curtain to keep out the light . We children were constantly admonished to " keep the noise down " ; but as far as we could tell , most of the noise was coming from the posterior of my father . He farted often and with an authoritative loudness . His most - oft repeated fart was what we kids called the " motor boat " . [SEP]  (A) Almost nothing kept the noise from reaching my father 's bedroom . (B) None of the above choices . (C) We kids kept playing with the motor boat at night . (D) We farted often with a loudness .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What may have been your reason for leaving Max at home ? [SEP] Max was pissed that I did n't walk him though . He 's too big , and he killed a dog down that road , so it 's best he stay at home . It started to rain , so we only made it to the stop sign . [SEP]  (A) He was starting to get violent . (B) It started to rain and I knew he would n't walk in it . (C) The dog down the road almost killed Max . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: He was starting to get violent .

column1: Why is there a baby swing on a tree ? [SEP] This one is linked to being to the bus stop first , so that 's usually not a problem any more . One other thing was that the woman 's house where the bus stop is has a baby swing on the tree , and he and the younger girl try to set ' records ' by winding up the swing more than the other . Audrey always says she wins , and Paul always breaks down . She 's quite the antagonizer , and her mom has to keep yelling at her about that . [SEP]  (A) Because the kids enjoy playing on it . (B) Because it allows the girl to set records . (C) Because another swing is linked to the bus stop . (D) Because it allows the girl to antagonize Paul .
column2: Because the kids enjoy playing on it .

column1: What might be different if the narrator did n't go on vacation ? [SEP] A lot of stuff has happened since the last time I posted ! I ' m sorry I ' ve dropped the ball on that one - in my defense , we did go on vacation and drive halfway across the country . That did take up some of my time ! [SEP]  (A) They would have dropped the ball (B) They would n't have posted sooner (C) They would have posted sooner (D) They would have gone across the country
column2: They would have posted sooner

column1: What might be different if the narrator still used the studio ? [SEP] Of course , he had him in the boat all day . Meanwhile , I was cleaning out the studio . The mice had been quite active there in the years I have n't used it . Took me most of Saturday and half of Sunday to get things into reasonable shape and sort out all the clay materials . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) The mice would n't be active in there (C) The mice would be active in there (D) He would n't have taken him on the boat all day
column2: The mice would n't be active in there

column1: Why will the capris definitely fit me this year ? [SEP] However there was one pair of black capris that I knew should fit me . They were very tight on me last year , so I thought , oh yeah they will definetely fit me this year . So I pulled them on thinking I could still wear these to work , but as soon as I had the zipper done up and let go , they dropped back to the ground . So in the long run . [SEP]  (A) Because I could still wear these to work . (B) None of the above choices . (C) Because they are black . (D) Because I 've lost weight .
column2: Because I 've lost weight .

column1: Why are you trying to recall the dream and understand it 's meaning ? [SEP] I remember going out the back door and having to walk around the building . It seems like such a real memory , but I know it never happened . What I do n't know is why I have dreamt about it at least twice , and possibly more times that I do n't remember , when I have never actually been there . Most of the time my dreams are just strange and do n't make much sense , but there are times , like last night , when they seem earily real or that they are trying to show me something . [SEP]  (A) I want to write a story from this dream (B) I want to be sure that I pay attention to my dreams because this one is recurring (C) I want to keep a dream journal starting with this dream (D) None of the above choices .
column2: I want to be sure that I pay attention to my dreams because this one is recurring

column1: Why would we need someone to watch a peanut ? [SEP] Finally , even though we were having so much fun , it was time to leave and go pick up our little peanut . Debbie 's friend Nancy was kind enough to watch her so Mom and Dad could get away for a night . Thanks so much ! And congratulations to Dawn and John . [SEP]  (A) We needed to make sure it was n't turned into peanut butter . (B) Because Dawn and John might have tried to steal it . (C) Peanut is a term sometimes used to describe a small child . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Peanut is a term sometimes used to describe a small child .

column1: Why did the writer break down ? [SEP] It sounds cliche , but I really meant to post . At first I was just whatever , I 'll post tomorrow and then it just got worse . I tried once at the end of July but when I got here and started writing I broke down . [SEP]  (A) Because they were sad about something . (B) Because they really meant to post . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because they just started writing .
column2: Because they were sad about something .

column1: Why might having the white background make tracing the bb 's easier ? [SEP] We filmed our shoot out today , and i think it went well . We decided on the back up plan of using a room at Luke 's house . We tried to making the setting all white so we could trace the direction which the bb 's easier . So not that s done we are going to capture the footage onto the computer and import it into flash . [SEP]  (A) Because bb 's are lighter colored , and they will show worse against the white background . (B) Because bb 's are darker colored , but they will show worse against the white background . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because bb 's are lighter colored , but they will show better against the white background .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What might happen when you let loose ? [SEP] During the actual part of the concert I let loose . I danced around , played air guitar , did crazy moves that correlated to their lyrics and jumped up and down banging my fist in the air to the beat of the melodies . My heart was so alive and free that I could n't stop smiling . [SEP]  (A) I would freely move and cheer . (B) None of the above choices . (C) I would freely sing along to the melodies . (D) I would feel a strong urge to bang something with my fist .
column2: I would freely move and cheer .

column1: What might happen when you let loose ? [SEP] During the actual part of the concert I let loose . I danced around , played air guitar , did crazy moves that correlated to their lyrics and jumped up and down banging my fist in the air to the beat of the melodies . My heart was so alive and free that I could n't stop smiling . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) I would freely sing along to the melodies . (C) I would feel a strong urge to bang something with my fist . (D) I would stop my friend from playing the air guitar at the concert .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What might be different now that the narrator has graduated ? [SEP] I GRADUATED HIGH SCHOOL oh fuckin shit i did it . I waited so long to be done with high school and be done with getting up at fucking 6 oclock every morning . I ' m so proud of myself that i graduated i never really doubted that i would n't graduate but I ' m just glad its done and over with . Naomi comes today and I ' m about to go leave and pick her from jfk and I ' m excited but scared haha she can be so much fun or make the day miserable . [SEP]  (A) They will no longer have to wake up at 6 o clock (B) They will be sad to leave school behind (C) None of the above choices . (D) They will not have to pick Naomi up
column2: They will no longer have to wake up at 6 o clock

column1: What 's a likely reason the writer asked if she should bring a swim suit ? [SEP] I spoke with Maria on the phone a few hours ago . I was asking if there was anything I should bring - swim suit , blankets , movies ... Me : Ooh ! I could bring Scattergories Junior . Maria : What 's that?Me : It 's like a mix between Boggle and Scrabble . It 's really fun . Then there was a silence at the other end of the line . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Because she wanted to hear silence on the other end of the line . (C) Because it 's good to wear for playing Scattergories Junior (D) Because it goes well with the blankets .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: Why did the boys want to have lunch before continuing up the trail ? [SEP] The air is a bit thin , making exercise ( like climbing mountain passes ) a bit of a challenge . We entered the basin via the Grandview Trailhead , with a 4 mile hike back to Betsy Lake where we established camp . Here 's a map of the area : We reached the trailhead at about 11:00 , when the boys decided to have their lunch before hitting the trail . We ate and put the finishing touches on our packs and took off . [SEP]  (A) They wanted to put off the hike as long as they could before starting (B) They wanted to get some fuel in before beginning the main hike (C) They had not had any breakfast yet (D) They were hungry because it was almost lunch time
column2: They wanted to get some fuel in before beginning the main hike

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer is finding it hard to breathe ? [SEP] Has he already done it ? Is he already dead ? I ca n't swallow when my mind asks this question the first time and the second time it swirls back around ; I am finding it hard to breathe . Then that voice is back telling me that I still have time , that I just have to find him before it is too late . And I have to believe this because , even though it seems unlikely that he would still be alive ; if he is not , there is no hope for the world ... or at least not my world . This conviction that spread through me gives rise to other questions . [SEP]  (A) Because they ca n't swallow . (B) Because they are thinking about a difficult subject matter . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because the writer has time .
column2: Because they are thinking about a difficult subject matter .

column1: Why might I think Fahrenheit 451 could be my speed even though I 'm not a big Sci Fi fan ? [SEP] I had gone to the Library briefly yesterday morning to see if Storytime was in session . It was n't , and I did n't stick around to get a card . So , last night , I started reading Farenheit 451-which may come as a surprise since I ' m generally not known for my fondness of sci - fi . It 's really " hard sci - fi " that I do n't care for , and it 's not for any other reason than it simply is not my cuppa . It 's nothing against the genre itself . But this book could be more my speed . [SEP]  (A) Because what I like is the " hard sci fi " and this book does seem like it . (B) Because what I do n't like is the " hard sci fi " and this book does seem like it . (C) Because what I do n't like is the " hard sci fi " and this book does n't seem like it . (D) Because what I do n't like is the " soft sci fi " and this book does n't seem like it .
column2: Because what I do n't like is the " hard sci fi " and this book does n't seem like it .

column1: What is probably true about the narrator ? [SEP] This guitar is in brand new condition , plain and simple . I bought the guitar in Jan of this year . Guitar is just not for me , so the guitar has sat in the case for months . [SEP]  (A) They will buy another new guitar (B) They do n't like guitar (C) None of the above choices . (D) They want to play the guitar
column2: They do n't like guitar

column1: Why did the one group have c - sections ? [SEP] One group of 12 mothers had cesarean sections and the other delivered naturally ( vaginally ) . All women were interviewed and given brain scans two to three weeks after giving birth . During the brain scans , parents listened to recordings of their own baby 's cry during the discomfort of a diaper change . [SEP]  (A) The one group had fear of birth so had c - sections . (B) The one group elected to have c - sections . (C) None of the above choices . (D) The one group had babies that did n't drop in the womb so they needed c - sections .
column2: The one group had babies that did n't drop in the womb so they needed c - sections .

column1: Why did G and I take a walk ? [SEP] During the twilight hours on Sunday evening , G and I took a walk on Castle Island . After having so much rain the previous few days , the weather finally cleared up and we figured it would be a nice time to visit . Castle Island is located in South Boston , which is practically a walk from Quincy , but I had never been there . It 's also very close to Logan Airport , so there are planes flying overhead seemingly every two minutes . [SEP]  (A) Because it was Sunday evening . (B) Because we 've been having so much rain . (C) Because we enjoy taking walks . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Because we enjoy taking walks .

column1: Why do you think you did not love going to Rome ? [SEP] So there 's no denying we went to Rome ... yeah yeah , everybody looooves Rome ... Got ta tell ya ... Did n't love it , was kinda nasty ... We were excited to arrive in Rome , escaping unseasonably bitter Autumn weather and a top of about 3 degrees in Finland ... It was hot , sunny , Italian , what more could we ask for . After waiting for an hour for our bags to make their leisurely way from the plane to the terminal we made our way to the Leonardo Express , the direct train to Termini , Rome 's Grand central railway station ( I wondered what LDV may have thought of his cartoon face emblazoned across every carriage as we rocked and rolled slowly into Rome ) . [SEP]  (A) I prefer countries and cities which are more modern and contemporary rather than older and classical (B) I was biased against Rome before we even landed in the country (C) Everybody who has been , talks constantly about Rome and about going to Italy , all of that meant that I anticipated a different experience to what I received and was thus let down (D) I do n't like Italian people and the concentration of Italians made me feel uncomfortable and confused
column2: Everybody who has been , talks constantly about Rome and about going to Italy , all of that meant that I anticipated a different experience to what I received and was thus let down

column1: What happened after you were offered the overtime ? [SEP] At work , I keep hearing a metallic / wood block sound that Rebecca tells me originates in the vents . This sound reminds me of a percussion instrument that is used in Air 's Universal Traveler , and every time the knocking starts in the vents I expect accompanying guitars . What a wonderful punishment it is to be caged inside of my head . I was offered overtime to help hand - jacketing a shipment due by midnight . [SEP]  (A) I declined because I felt like I wanted to go watch a movie instead (B) I declined because I wanted to go out drinking instead (C) I declined because I did not want to be at the shipping center so late because it is creepy at night (D) I decided to take it and worked that night because they pay was very good
column2: I decided to take it and worked that night because they pay was very good

column1: Why did Jon send me beautiful flowers for completing the race ? [SEP] I think I would like to do a run of this nature again in the future and if Susan is my running buddy that would be even better . Thanks Sue ! You planted the seed , helped me plan a training schedule and were there through the whole thing . Jon sent me these beautiful flowers for completing the race . [SEP]  (A) Because I would like to do a run of this nature again . (B) Because Sue planted the seed . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because Jon wanted to do something nice for me .
column2: Because Jon wanted to do something nice for me .

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer had to take down their game room ? [SEP] This wireless adapter is placed on the back of your Xbox , by usb . I had wireless network at home for years , It was great to have my Xbox any where in the house ! I had to take down my game room and so no more Xbox live for me . Well for now . [SEP]  (A) Because they needed the room for something else . (B) Because no more Xbox Live . (C) Because the writer had wireless network at home for years . (D) Because it was great to have the Xbox anywhere in the house .
column2: Because they needed the room for something else .

column1: What 's a possible reason the writer needs to switch up putters ? [SEP] I think I need to switch up putters and filling the wedge gap in my bag would be nice . Apparently , my putting style best suits a toe - down putter vs a face balanced putter , which I have right now . So , that might actually be the next purchase . [SEP]  (A) Because they would perform better with a different putter . (B) Because they need a face balanced putter . (C) Because they need to fill a wedge gap . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Because they would perform better with a different putter .

column1: What may be the reason Anna and I wanted to go hiking ? [SEP] Before Anna and I had started out that day , we consulted with a park ranger and another expert of the area who 'd been hiking it for years . He 'd told us about two paths that were little known - one off the Cottonwood grove that took us to another pass that went through a gap in the mountains , and another of the mountain gap trail that would take us around the mountain to the Aztec cave ( just a name for a large cave ) . We easily found the first one but the second eluded us even after we trailblazed awhile . Part of the path we took as we trailblazed . [SEP]  (A) We wanted to explore gaps in the mountains (B) None of the above choices . (C) Wanted to draw maps of mountain (D) Wanted to talk with park ranger
column2: We wanted to explore gaps in the mountains

column1: What may be the reason Anna and I wanted to go hiking ? [SEP] Before Anna and I had started out that day , we consulted with a park ranger and another expert of the area who 'd been hiking it for years . He 'd told us about two paths that were little known - one off the Cottonwood grove that took us to another pass that went through a gap in the mountains , and another of the mountain gap trail that would take us around the mountain to the Aztec cave ( just a name for a large cave ) . We easily found the first one but the second eluded us even after we trailblazed awhile . Part of the path we took as we trailblazed . [SEP]  (A) Wanted to talk with park ranger (B) None of the above choices . (C) We wanted to find a cave (D) Wanted to draw maps of mountain
column2: We wanted to find a cave

column1: Why was last night so relaxing ? [SEP] So I had to order a new one . Craap . Last night was so relaxing . The group went to Old Chicago and then chilled on the riverfront for a few minutes . Went back to Juan 's and I took like a 15 min long hot shower . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Because they took a 15 minute shower . (C) Because they chilled on the riverfront . (D) Because they went back to Juan 's .
column2: Because they chilled on the riverfront .

column1: What may have caused the trees to be uprooted ? [SEP] Trees got uprooted and blown into neighbors ' yards . On 40th and Shea , which is just a few miles from me , a whole row of powerlines fell into the street ( I saw a friends ' pictures of the destruction ) . At ASU , a whole building was ripped apart . The destruction is fucking scary , but the storm was SO COOL . [SEP]  (A) Our neighbors did n't want the trees in their yards . (B) None of the above choices . (C) ASU wanted to remove them before an intense storm tears them down . (D) Powerlines fell onto them .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: Why did the writer decline ? [SEP] But knowing it was a sales ploy I had to decline and leave , but I did enjoy it . So good luck to her this young lady who said she was from Israel , hence I suppose why the salt was from the Dead Sea . And I admit it worked my hands were soft and the dirt cleaned out of my pause . I now wish I had the money , for the interaction it would have been worth it . [SEP]  (A) Because the salt was from the Dead Sea . (B) Because they did n't trust the product or the saleswoman . (C) Because they did enjoy it . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Because they did n't trust the product or the saleswoman .

column1: What might be different if the narrator did n't hang out with the MM team ? [SEP] Other than the spiritual experience , it was a great experience hanging out with the entire MM team ! We had loads of fun and hilarious experiences ! Wah ah ! And I can not imagine i actually drove in Malaysia ! [SEP]  (A) They would not have had hilarious experiences (B) They would have driven in Malaysia (C) They would have had fun (D) They would have had hilarious experiences
column2: They would not have had hilarious experiences

column1: What might be different if the narrator did n't hang out with the MM team ? [SEP] Other than the spiritual experience , it was a great experience hanging out with the entire MM team ! We had loads of fun and hilarious experiences ! Wah ah ! And I can not imagine i actually drove in Malaysia ! column1: What kind of statement was the guy with the Harley Davidson sticker on his car trying to make when he backed up in front of me ? (D) He was telling me that   Moto Guzzi motorcycles are better than Harley Davidson motorcycles .
column2: He was telling me that Harley Davidson motorcycles are better than Moto Guzzi motorcycles .

column1: Why was it a triumph to hear Beanie purring ? It was a real triumph when I was able to put my head near Beanie and hear her purring a few weeks ago ! She 's one of those cats that purrs with gusto , and now I can easily hear her purring even if I ' m just near her in the room . Thanks to my cochlear implants , I no longer have to rest my ear against her chest . [SEP]  (A) Because the cat purrs with gusto . (B) Because the writer could feel vibrations . (C) Because the writer was losing their hearing . (D) Because the writer has cochlear implants .
column2: Because the writer was losing their hearing .

[SEP]  (A) Interactions between others would become something different . (B) People would analyse their experiences deeply . (C) Interactions between others would n't become different . (D) People would stop communicating with each other .

column1: What may have caused the UNT to partner with Haskell Indian Nations University ? [SEP] UNT will partner with Haskell Indian Nations University in Lawrence , Kan. , and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency to build a diverse workforce that can meet the country 's environmental demands . Under a memorandum of understanding signed Sept. 5 , the groups pledged to work together to increase the number of American Indian students pursuing professional careers in environmental fields , including policy , economics and science . " This new partnership expands the long tradition our university has had in working with the EPA to find solutions to some of our nation 's most pressing environmental and societal problems , " President Gretchen M. Bataille says . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) They both wanted to start working with the EPA . (C) They wanted to promote uniformity in employees . (D) They wanted to promote variety in employees .
column2: They wanted to promote variety in employees .

column1: Why do they want the summer to end ? [SEP] It 's not how hot the summers are here as much as how long they go on . Temperatures started topping 100 degrees in May this year , and for a little while it 's bracing . You think you 'll fight it out , but by August you are desperate and the sun seems to hang smug and sullen at dead noon all day long . There 's a vicious , personal quality to the heat of these late summer days , like summer has it 's teeth in your neck and it 's going to shake you till you 're limp , wring the last bit of juiciness out of you before , if we 're lucky , it dies in late October . [SEP]  (A) because they 'll fight it out (B) None of the above choices . (C) because it is too hot (D) because by August you are desperate
column2: because it is too hot

column1: What may have caused some of the pilot to be cut ? [SEP] But even those few things that could have made for a plot were cut . In the movie , they know instantly , and find the castle instantly . This is interesting , because in this part of the book there was a lot of ( rather nice ) depiction of childlike reactions and emotions to an unknown situation . Being scared of dark , being cold , hungry , thirsty ... nothing of that featured in the movie . And that was a good thing . Because of this there was no temptation to see the children as children . [SEP]  (A) They did n't want to make people scared yet . (B) It 's an adaptation of a complex work . (C) None of the above choices . (D) It 's an adaptation of multiple books .
column2: It 's an adaptation of a complex work .

column1: What may have caused your dad to raise you on his own ? [SEP]  (A) He wanted to be my role - model . (B) None of the above choices . (C) My mother was n't present in my life . (D) He did n't want my mother in my life .
column2: My mother was n't present in my life .

column1: Why is it necessary for the legislature to enact statutes that trump court rules ? [SEP] It generally leads to better drafted rules , because the courts can take more time to focus on details that impact the court system than legislators , and also because legislators tend to let minor problems with court rules fester unaddressed in places where there is no unilateral ability to change court rules . It also maintains a status quo in which the legislature is not meddling unduly with the affairs of the judicial branch , which is a separate and co - equal branch of government . The legislature can , of course , enact statutes that trump court rules if necessary . [SEP]  (A) Because the court rules may not reflect the legislature 's views but does reflect the people 's . (B) Because the court rules may reflect the legislature 's but does n't reflect the people 's views . (C) Because the court rules may reflect the legislature 's and thus the people 's views . (D) Because the court rules may not reflect the legislature 's and thus the people 's views .
column2: Because the court rules may not reflect the legislature 's and thus the people 's views .

column1: What 's a possible reason the man stabbed the victim ? [SEP] Passenger Garnet Caton said the victim was sleeping with headphones on before he was stabbed 40 or 50 times by the man sitting next to him . " We heard this bloodcurdling scream and turned around , and the guy was standing up , stabbing this guy repeatedly , like 40 or 50 times , " Caton said from a hotel in Brandon , Manitoba , where he and other passengers had been taken to rest . Caton said the bus stopped and the passengers scrambled to disembark while the suspect allegedly began methodically carving up the man 's body . The attacker severed the man 's head with a large hunting knife and held the head up by the door for others to see . [SEP]  (A) Because a passenger was watching . (B) None of the above choices . (C) Because there was a bloodcurdling scream . (D) Because the bus stopped .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What may be your family 's reason for flying to the Phillipines ? [SEP] It was the first time my family had returned after immigrating here in 1980 . My father wanted to see the Philippines again , just in case he did n't survive his surgery that would be later in the year . I remember the flight very well because over the Sea of Japan , there was extreme turbulence ( as usual ) and I got catapulted down the aisle . [SEP]  (A) I wanted to travel back there and check it out . (B) My family was immigrating there . (C) It would be their last chance to view it . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: It would be their last chance to view it .

column1: Why do you think he simply does not fix his body odor problem ? [SEP] This guy has some seriously bad BO . I ' ve mentioned it before , just kinda bugging him that whatever deodorant he used was n't working , but since then I ' ve pretty much left him alone because one of the operators jokes with him about it almost daily , trying to prompt him to use more deodorant , and that kind of worked , but not enough . Today was n't even that hot ! [SEP]  (A) he does not care what others think (B) He is unaware of how bad it is and likely does n't realize that he smells (C) he does not care that the smell is offensive to other people (D) his girlfriend likes the way he smells and he does not want to change it because she likes it

column2: i might have gotten drunk and passed out on the top of it .

column2: AIDS causes immune deficiency making someone feel tired and fatigued regularly

column1: Why did you have the Polaroid to mark the last cigarette he had had ? [SEP] He then asked for a picture , we had a Poloroid , to mark the day of his last cigarette . ) When we returned to the orphanage the second time , we were able to finish painting several murals that a local school teacher and her students had started . In order to maintain the integrity of their original work , and yet finish the project , we outlined their work in black and filled in the areas that were not complete . It was a calm and restorative project . [SEP]  (A) in order to help him remember the taste and sensation of smoking (B) It was a reminder for him as to why he quit and how far he had come since that last cigarette (C) in order to remind him that he can have a cigarette again at any time to relive that feeling (D) None of the above choices .
